description: Alkyl benzenes with n carbon atoms: C(n)H(2n-6).
references: N. L. Biggs et al., Graph Theory 1736-1936, Oxford, 1976, p. 71.
G. Polya, Algebraische Berechnung der Anzahl der Isomeren einiger organischer Verbindungen, Zeit. f. Kristall., 93 (1936), 415-443 (p. 422).
R. C. Read, The Enumeration of Acyclic Chemical Compounds, pp. 25-61 of A. T. Balaban, ed., Chemical Applications of Graph Theory, Ac. Press, 1976; see p. p. 22, Eq. (H).
N. J. A. Sloane, A Handbook of Integer Sequences, Academic Press, 1973 (includes this sequence).
N. J. A. Sloane and Simon Plouffe, The Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences, Academic Press, 1995 (includes this sequence).
links: Vincenzo Librandi, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..100
I. Dolinka, J. East, A. Evangelou, D. FitzGerald, N. Ham, et al., Enumeration of idempotents in diagram semigroups and algebras, arXiv preprint arXiv:1408.2021, 2014
example: a(8)=4 because the unique isomers are 1,2-Dimethylbenzene; 1,3-Dimethylbenzene; 1,4-Dimethylbenzene, 1-Ethylbenzene. All have formula C(8)H(10)
mathematica: max = 28; b[x_] := Sum[c[k]*x^k, {k, 0, max}]; f[x_] := Sum[d[k]*x^k, {k, 0, max}]; c[0] = c[1] = 1; d[0] = d[1] = 1; eqb = Thread[ CoefficientList[ Series[ b[x] - (1 + (1/6)*x*(b[x]^3 + 3*b[x]*b[x^2] + 2*b[x^3])), {x, 0, max}], x] == 0][[3 ;; max + 1]]; eqf = Thread[ CoefficientList[ Series[ f[x] - (1/12)*(b[x]^6 + 4*b[x^2]^3 + 2*b[x^3]^2 + 3*b[x]^2*b[x^2]^2 + 2*b[x^6]), {x, 0, max}], x] == 0][[ 3 ;; max + 1]]; s[2] = Solve[eqb[[1]] && eqf[[1]]][[1]]; Do[eqb = Rest[eqb] /. s[k]; eqf = Rest[eqf] /. s[k]; s[k+1] = Solve[eqb[[1]] && eqf[[1]]][[1]], {k, 2, max - 1}]; Join[{0,0,0,0,0}, Table[d[k], {k, 0, max}] /. Flatten[ Table[s[k], {k, 2, max}]]](* _Jean-Fran√ßois Alcover_, Oct 12 2011, after g.f. *)
author: _N. J. A. Sloane_.
extensions: Better description from Bruce Corrigan (scentman(AT)myfamily.com), Oct 23 2002
